page.title: 10PEBMARSH LOCAL NEWS
page.content: Hedingham School children from Pebmarsh helped Mrs.Pearson to raise money to build a new{bus shelter}near the King's Head.The children organised a bric-brac stall to raise enough money for the building materials while land was provided by Mr.J.Nott. The{Village Variety Club,}founded in 1984,organised a Treasure Hunt on the 21st April 1985.The winners were Mr.and Mrs.Jamieson and Miss Daws. {The King's Head}closed on the 30th April 1985 when the landlord,Mr.Peter Daws, retired.The brewery,Ind Coope,is now trying to sell the Pub,but for the first time in many,many years Pebmarsh is without a Public House. The Church is organising a{Stewardship {Campaign}to try to bring more people into the church,to help those in need and to raise more money. {STOP-PRESS:}Pub to re-open August 1985
